content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-3xl mx-auto border-4 border-sky-900 rounded-lg

content.text: En esta parte, usted escuchará preguntas o enunciados en inglés seguidos de tres o cuatro opciones, también en inglés. Las preguntas o enunciados y las opciones se dirán solo una vez.  Seleccione la mejor opción para cada pregunta o enunciado y oscurezca el espacio de la letra correspondiente en la hoja de respuestas.
content.name: 3Ovd
4Cs6

content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-3xl mx-auto grid grid-cols-2

content.text:
Example:
Man: Are you Monica?
Woman: Yes, I am. Who are you?
Man: I’m Lola’s cousin. You are her sister, right?

Who is the man?
A Monica’s sister
B Lola’s sister
C Lola’s cousin
D Monica’s friend
content.name: szZh
HxC4

content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-3xl mx-auto

content.textual:
What are you having for dinner?
I have a headache.
I’m having a hard time.
I’m having some cereal.
I have a dog
C

Who should you call in case of an emergency?
A doctor
A restaurant
A dog
A

What should I do after completing the application form?
Click on submit.
Call a doctor.
Eat some bananas.
A

*Woman: Are you John?\nMan: Yes, I am. Who are you?\nWoman: I’m Britney’s sister. You’re his friend, aren’t you?
Who is the woman?  
Britney’s sister
John’s sister
John’s friend
Britney’s friend
A

*Woman: What do you want for Christmas?\nMan: I want a new computer! You?\nWoman: I want one too, I could have a new phone, but I prefer having a computer.
What does the man want for Christmas?
A computer and a phone
A computer
A phone
An old computer
B

Where do you want to go after school?
To sleep.
To the movies.
Go to the movies.
Go to sleep.
B

Have you done your homework?
I have tons of homework.
No, I haven’t.
Homework is easy.
I don’t like homework.
B

What did you do after watching TV?
I love watching TV.
I want to have dinner after watching TV.
I did my homework.
I like watching TV and having dinner.
C

My head is pounding, what should I have?
An aspirin
My head hurts!
You should go to the park.
You have an appointment.
A

How many books do you read per year?
A hundred and fifty.
I love books about love.
Every year I buy many books.
I read many books every month.
A

*Woman: Hello! Are we going to the supermarket?\nMan: I don’t know, why? Are we missing any food?\nWoman: No, we are missing soap and a mop…
What are they buying at the supermarket?
Some food
Any food and soap
Soap and a mop
Food and a mop
C

*Man: What kind of movies do you like?  I bet you love romantic movies!\nWoman: Well, I like romantic movies but I’m not such a great fan… I think unsolved crimes movies are better like… Mystery.\nMan: Oh, I love those too!
What kind of movies does the man love?
Romantic movies
Mystery movies
Comedy movies
Romantic and mystery movies
B

*Man: How many onions do you want?\nWoman: I don’t know, I think I may take five\nMan: Are you sure?\nWoman: Okay, two more…
How many onions is the woman buying?
Two
Five
Seven
C

What do you want to do after school?
(A) I start school at 7:00 am
(B) I want chicken salad.
(C) Go to the movies.
C

Where are your books?
At home
I want to read a new book.
Today
A

*Man: Jessica is feeling sick, her head is pounding.\nWoman: Oh, yes, she just had an aspirin.
What’s wrong with Jessica?
She took an aspirin.
She has a headache. 
She is sick.
B

*Man: I usually go to the park to walk my dog, but today, it was pouring rain, so we had to wait and play at home.
What did the man do?
He played with his dog at home.
He usually goes to the park with his dog
It was pouring rain
A

*Woman: When you are in class, you shouldn’t shout. It is important to pay attention to the teacher.
What does the woman say?
Talk to your classmates during class.
You shouldn’t run.
You shouldn’t speak loudly.
C

*Man: I usually miss my friends when I’m on vacation. Now that I’m back at school, I see them every day.
Where is the boy?
On vacation
Missing his friends
At school
C

*Woman: I always wear sunglasses when I go to the beach. They look really cool.
Why does the woman wear sunglasses?
To go the beach
Because they look cool.
To protect her eyes from the Sun.
B

*Man: Some street performers are amazing, I saw one on my last trip to Paris last month. He jumped and danced but didn’t sing. 
What did the street performer do?
In Paris
Sing
Jumped and danced
C

*Woman: Carol is from the beautiful city of Los Angeles in California. She lives with her parents and her three brothers.
Where does Carol live?
With her parents.
With her three brothers.
In Los Angeles, California.
C

*Man: Whose sunglasses are these?\nWoman: I think they are Greg’s sunglasses?\nMan: Really? I thought they were Michael’s… Oh wait, they are Greg’s, I just remembered he was wearing them earlier this morning.
Who owns the sunglasses?
Greg
Michael
They don’t know
A

*Man: Do you drink tea or coffee for breakfast?\nWoman: I usually have tea and some juice but this time I’ll have coffee.
What is the woman drinking for breakfast?
Coffee
Juice
Tea
A

*Man: Where is Max from? \nWoman: Well, he lives in Brazil but he’s Canadian… He used to live in Mexico…
Where is Max from?
Mexico
Canada
Brazil
B

*Man: The Venice carnival lasts longer than the Sydney carnival. The Rio de Janeiro carnival lasts longer than the Venice carnival.
Which is the longest carnival?
Sydney
Rio de Janeiro
Venice
B

*Woman: When traveling, taxis are more expensive than buses. The cheapest option is to walk or to ride a bike.
What is the most expensive option to get around a city?
Buses
Riding a bike
Taxis
C

*Man: Rio de Janeiro is older than Chicago, but Rome is the oldest city of all three. 
Which is the oldest city?
Rio de Janeiro
Rome
Chicago
B

*Man: What happened when Ben fell into the water?\nWoman: Well, everyone was enjoying the trip and the boat was passing by the Golden gate bridge. I was looking after the group when I heard someone shout…. We had to go back to the dock right away.
Where was the boat when Ben fell into the water?
They were enjoying the trip.
In the dock
Passing by the Golden gate bridge
C


*Woman: What are you having for lunch?\nMan: I don’t know, I think I’ll have a club sandwich, or a steak…\nWoman: Why not both? We can share.\nMan: That’s a great idea!
What is the man having for lunch?
A club sandwich.
A steak.
A club sandwich and a steak.
C
